Telford United]] (loan) | caps2 = 6 | goals2 = 1 | years3 = 2010 | clubs3 = → [[Hinckley United F.C.|Hinckley United]] (loan) | caps3 = 5 | goals3 = 0 | years4 = 2010–2012 | clubs4 = [[Hinckley United F.C.|Hinckley United]] | caps4 = 65 | goals4 = 29 | years5 = 2012 | clubs5 = → [[Luton Town F.C.|Luton Town]] (loan) | caps5 = 9 | goals5 = 5 | years6 = 2012–2014 | clubs6 = [[Luton Town F.C.|Luton Town]] | caps6 = 88 | goals6 = 47 | years7 = 2014–2015 | clubs7 = [[Brentford F.C.|Brentford]] | caps7 = 47 | goals7 = 18 | years8 = 2015–2017 | clubs8 = [[Burnley F.C.|Burnley]] | caps8 = 73 | goals8 = 32 | years9 = 2017– | clubs9 = [[Watford F.C.|Watford]] | caps9 = 51 | goals9 = 10 | nationalyears1 = 2012–2014 | nationalteam1 = [[England national football C team|England C]] | nationalcaps1 = 6 | nationalgoals1 = 2 | club-update = 13:58, 3 March 2019 (UTC) | nationalteam-update = }} '''Andre Anthony Gray''' (born 26 June 1991) is an English professional [[Association football|footballer]] who plays as a [[Forward (association football)#Striker|striker]] for {{English football updater|Watford}} club [[Watford F.C.|Watford]].
A product of the [[Shrewsbury Town F.C.|Shrewsbury Town]] youth system, Gray came to prominence after scoring 57 goals in 111 appearances in a two-season spell with [[Luton Town F.C.|Luton Town]]. He represented [[England national football C team|England C]] at international level.
==Club career== ===Shrewsbury Town=== Gray began his career in the [[Football Academy|academy]] at hometown club [[Wolverhampton Wanderers F.C.|Wolverhampton Wanderers]], but was released at age 13.<ref name="Luton 1–0 Wolves">{{cite news |title=Luton 1–0 Wolves |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/20863618 |publisher=BBC Sport |date=5 January 2013 |accessdate=22 August 2016}}</ref> Gray joined the youth system at [[EFL League Two|League Two]] club [[Shrewsbury Town F.C.|Shrewsbury Town]] in 2004, signing his first professional one-year contract prior to the start of the [[2009–10 Shrewsbury Town F.C. season|2009–10 season]].<ref>{{cite web |title=Hatters Heroes – (G) – Andre Gray |url=http://www.luton.vitalfootball.co.uk/sitepage.asp?a=356719 |publisher=Vital Luton |date=21 April 2014 |accessdate=22 August 2016}}</ref> Awarded the number 20 shirt, he made his debut on the opening day of the season, coming on as an 89th-minute [[Substitute (association football)|substitute]] for [[Nathan Elder]] in a 3–1 win over [[Burton Albion F.C.|Burton Albion]].<ref>{{cite web |first=Martin |last=Wild |title=Shrewsbury 3–1 Burton Albion |url=http://www.shrewsburytown.com/page/MatchReport/0,,10443~49141,00.html |publisher=Shrewsbury Town F.C. |date=8 August 2009 |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20120223183511/http://www.shrewsburytown.com/page/MatchReport/0%2C%2C10443~49141%2C00.html |archivedate=23 February 2012 |deadurl=yes}}</ref> An injury crisis saw Gray make four further cameos,<ref name=sb0910/> with what would be his final appearance for the club coming as a 57th-minute replacement for [[Kris Bright]] in a 2–0 [[Football League Trophy]] second round defeat to [[Accrington Stanley F.C.|Accrington Stanley]] on 20 October.<ref>{{cite news |title=Accrington Stanley 2–0 Shrewsbury |url=http://news.bbc.co.uk/sport1/hi/football/8314692.stm |publisher=BBC Sport |date=20 October 2009 |accessdate=29 June 2014}}</ref> He spent periods of the 2009–10 season away on loan, but competition for places meant that Gray was relegated to the reserve team substitutes' bench.<ref name="Gray makes Hinckley switch"/> Gray was released by Shrewsbury on 14 May 2010,<ref>{{cite news |title=Shrewsbury Town release captain and four others |url=http://news.bbc.co.uk/sport1/hi/football/teams/s/shrewsbury/8682440.stm |publisher=BBC Sport |date=14 May 2010 |accessdate=15 May 2010}}</ref> having made just five appearances for the club.<ref name=sb0910/> Looking back on his time at Shrewsbury, Gray said "I was at the stage in my life where I thought everything was set for me. I didn't really care about playing in Shrewsbury's reserves, which it shouldn't have been".<ref name="Andre Gray Bossing Things Both On And Off The Pitch">{{cite news |first=Matt |last=Badcock |title=Andre Gray bossing things both on and off the pitch |url=http://www.thenonleaguefootballpaper.com/latest-news/conference-premier-step-one/10093/andre-gray-bossing-things-both-on-and-off-the-pitch/ |newspaper=The Non-League Paper |location=London |date=20 March 2014 |accessdate=17 September 2016}}</ref>
===A.F.C. Telford United=== Gray joined [[Conference North]] club [[A.F.C. Telford United]] on a one-month [[Loan (sports)|loan]] on 26 November 2009.<ref>{{cite news |title=AFC Telford make treble signing |url=http://news.bbc.co.uk/sport1/hi/football/eng_conf/8381035.stm |publisher=BBC Sport |date=26 November 2009 |accessdate=8 May 2012}}</ref> Gray's good form meant that his loan was extended for a second month.<ref>{{cite news |title=Shrewsbury's Andre Gray extends loan deal at Telford |url=http://news.bbc.co.uk/sport1/hi/football/eng_conf/8435256.stm |publisher=BBC Sport |date=30 December 2009 |accessdate=29 June 2014}}</ref> He scored his first goal for the club with a late winner against local rivals [[Stafford Rangers F.C.|Stafford Rangers]] on Boxing Day.<ref>{{cite news |title=AFC Telford United 2–1 Stafford Rangers |url=http://news.bbc.co.uk/sport1/hi/football/eng_conf/8431313.stm |publisher=BBC Sport |date=26 December 2009 |accessdate=8 May 2012}}</ref> Competition for places meant that Gray gradually lost his place in the team and he returned to Shrewsbury Town on 5 February 2010.<ref>{{cite news |title=AFC Telford decide not to renew Andre Gray's loan |url=http://news.bbc.co.uk/sport1/hi/football/eng_conf/8500191.stm |publisher=BBC Sport |date=5 February 2010 |accessdate=29 June 2014}}</ref> Gray played six times for the Bucks, scoring once.<ref name="Non-League Club Directory 2011 1"/>
===Hinckley United=== On 5 March 2010, Gray joined Conference North club [[Hinckley United F.C.|Hinckley United]] on an emergency one-month loan.<ref name="Gray makes Hinckley switch">{{cite news |title=Gray makes Hinckley switch |url=http://www.skysports.com/football/news/12875/6004936/gray-makes-hinckley-switch |publisher=Sky Sports |date=5 March 2010 |accessdate=22 August 2016}}</ref> He made five appearances and scored no goals for the club, before returning to Shrewsbury Town.<ref name="Non-League Club Directory 2011 2"/>
Gray returned to [[De Montfort Park]] in June 2010 and signed a permanent one-year contract with the club.<ref>{{cite news |title=Hinckley United bring in four new faces |url=http://news.bbc.co.uk/sport1/hi/football/eng_conf/8732748.stm |publisher=BBC Sport |date=10 June 2010 |accessdate=8 May 2012}}</ref> His first goal for the club was a late equaliser in a 2–2 draw with [[Harrogate Town F.C.|Harrogate Town]] on 4 September.<ref>{{cite news |title=Andre Gray's strike earns point for Knitters |url=http://www.leicestermercury.co.uk/andre-grey-s-strike-earns-point-knitters/story-12074951-detail/story.html |newspaper=Leicester Mercury |date=6 September 2010 |accessdate=22 August 2016 }}{{dead link|date=March 2018 |bot=InternetArchiveBot |fix-attempted=yes }}</ref> After two further goals that month in defeats to [[Guiseley A.F.C.|Guiseley]] and [[Eastwood Town F.C.|Eastwood Town]], Gray's goalscoring form dried up. His form returned in late March 2011, when he scored a [[Brace (sports)|brace]] in a 4–0 drubbing of [[Redditch United F.C.|Redditch United]].<ref>{{cite news |title=Hinckley 4–0 Redditch United |url=http://www.skysports.com/football/hinckley-vs-redditch-united/219922 |publisher=Sky Sports |date=26 March 2011 |accessdate=22 August 2016}}</ref> He scored four goals in a 7–2 thrashing of [[Solihull Moors F.C.|Solihull Moors]] on 23 April,<ref>{{cite news |title=Hinckley United win 7–2 at Solihull Moors |url=http://www.leicestermercury.co.uk/hinckley-united-win-7-2-solihull-moors/story-12059329-detail/story.html |newspaper=Leicester Mercury |date=25 April 2011 |accessdate=22 August 2016 }}{{dead link|date=March 2018 |bot=InternetArchiveBot |fix-attempted=yes }}</ref> before ending the [[2010–11 Football Conference#Conference North|2010–11 season]] having made 35 appearances and scored 14 goals.<ref name="Non-League Club Directory 2012"/>
Gray remained with Hinckley for the [[2011–12 Football Conference#Conference North|2011–12 season]] and showed fine form, with his goalscoring exploits firing the Knitters to an [[FA Cup]] first round proper match versus [[Conference Premier]] club [[Tamworth F.C.|Tamworth]] on 12 November 2011.<ref>{{cite news |title=Hinckley Utd 2–2 Tamworth |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/15604826 |publisher=BBC Sport |date=12 November 2011 |accessdate=22 August 2016}}</ref> He scored the opening goal in the 2–2 draw, but couldn't find the net in the replay, resulting in a 1–0 defeat.<ref>{{cite news |title=Tamworth 1–0 Hinckley Utd |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/15732449 |publisher=BBC Sport |date=22 November 2011 |accessdate=22 August 2016}}</ref> Gray also helped Hinckley reach the second round proper of the [[FA Trophy]], scoring a late winner against Conference Premier club [[Wrexham A.F.C.|Wrexham]] in the first round,<ref>{{cite news |title=FA Trophy: Wrexham 1–2 Hinckley United |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/16118988 |publisher=BBC Sport |date=10 December 2011 |accessdate=22 August 2016}}</ref> though he was unable to find the net against [[Luton Town F.C.|Luton Town]] in the following round, to whom they were defeated 3–0 in a replay.<ref>{{cite news |title=Luton 3–0 Hinckley |url=http://www.skysports.com/football/luton-vs-hinckley/255449 |publisher=Sky Sports |date=23 January 2012 |accessdate=22 August 2016}}</ref> His exploits garnered him attention from [[EFL Championship|Championship]] clubs.<ref name="It's official: Town get Gray">{{cite web |title=It's official: Town get Gray |url=http://www.lutontown.co.uk/page/NewsDetail/0,,10372~2687930,00.html |publisher=Luton Town F.C. |date=22 March 2012 |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20120324184401/http://www.lutontown.co.uk/page/NewsDetail/0%2C%2C10372~2687930%2C00.html |archivedate=24 March 2012 |deadurl=yes}}</ref> Gray made 45 appearances and scored 23 goals during the 2011–12 season.<ref name="Non-League Club Directory 2013 1"/> Gray departed Hinckley in the summer of 2012, having made 85 appearances and scored 37 goals across his two spells with the club.<ref name="Non-League Club Directory 2011 2"/><ref name="Non-League Club Directory 2012"/><ref name="Non-League Club Directory 2013 1"/> Gray looked back on his years playing part-time with Hinckley as the point at which he regained his focus, saying "as long as I still had a job and was getting paid, it was OK. Until I started playing and realised that full-time football was the only thing I wanted to do, it kicked me into gear. Being bored all day, waiting to go training, made me really want it".<ref name="Andre Gray Bossing Things Both On And Off The Pitch"/>
===Luton Town=== [[File:Andre Gray 1.png|thumb|upright|Gray lining up for [[Luton Town F.C.|Luton Town]] before the [[2012 Conference Premier play-off Final]]]]
On 22 March 2012, Gray signed for Conference Premier club Luton Town on loan until the end of the [[2011–12 Luton Town F.C. season|2011–12 season]] with a view to a permanent move, having impressed the club's backroom staff with his performances against the club in the FA Trophy.<ref name="It's official: Town get Gray"/> Going straight into the [[Starting lineup#Association football|starting lineup]], he scored on his debut in a 1–1 draw with [[Grimsby Town F.C.|Grimsby Town]] on 24 March and hit a goal in each of his next matches against [[York City F.C.|York City]], [[Braintree Town F.C.|Braintree Town]] and [[Hayes & Yeading United F.C.|Hayes & Yeading United]].<ref name=sb1112>{{soccerbase season|51675|2011|accessdate=22 August 2016}}</ref> This meant that Gray became the only player in Luton Town history to have scored in each of his first four matches for the club.<ref name="Gray is the new Claret"/> He scored his fifth goal in a 2–0 win over champions [[Fleetwood Town F.C.|Fleetwood Town]] in the last match of the season to secure Luton a fifth-place finish in the league and the last available remaining [[2011–12 Football Conference#Play-offs|play-off spot]].<ref>{{cite news |title=Fleetwood 0–2 Luton |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/17795915 |publisher=BBC Sport |date=28 April 2012 |accessdate=22 August 2016}}</ref> Gray scored the opening goal in the play-off semi-final first leg at home to Wrexham,<ref>{{cite news |first=Chris |last=Osborne |title=Luton 2–0 Wrexham |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/17881846 |publisher=BBC Sport |date=3 May 2012 |accessdate=22 August 2016}}</ref> which Luton won 3–2 on aggregate to set up a [[2012 Conference Premier play-off Final|final]] against York City at [[Wembley Stadium]].<ref>{{cite news |title=Wrexham 2–1 Luton Town (2–3 on agg) |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/17890877 |publisher=BBC Sport |date=7 May 2012 |accessdate=22 August 2016}}</ref> Luton lost the match 2–1, despite Gray scoring the opening goal after just 74 seconds.<ref>{{cite news |first=Phil |last=Maiden |title=Luton Town 1–2 York City |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/18049175 |publisher=BBC Sport |date=20 May 2012 |accessdate=22 August 2016}}</ref> In total, he scored seven goals in 12 appearances during his loan spell.<ref name="Non-League Club Directory 2013 2"/>
The day after the play-off final defeat, Gray signed a two-year professional contract with Luton for a fee of £30,000.<ref>{{cite news |title=Andre Gray joins Luton Town from Hinckley United |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/17475061 |publisher=BBC Sport |date=22 March 2012 |accessdate=22 August 2016}}</ref><ref>{{cite web |title=Gray deal becomes permanent |url=http://www.lutontown.co.uk/page/NewsDetail/0,,10372~2780972,00.html |publisher=Luton Town F.C. |date=21 May 2012 |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20120524061030/http://www.lutontown.co.uk/page/NewsDetail/0%2C%2C10372~2780972%2C00.html |archivedate=24 May 2012 |deadurl=yes}}</ref> Beginning the [[2012–13 Luton Town F.C. season|2012–13 season]] in a substitute role, Gray scored his first goal of the campaign in a 4–1 win over [[Macclesfield Town F.C.|Macclesfield Town]] on 1 September 2012 as he broke back into the starting lineup.<ref>{{cite news |title=Luton 4–1 Macclesfield |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/19378163 |publisher=BBC Sport |date=1 September 2012 |accessdate=22 August 2016}}</ref> Gray's performance in a 2–0 FA Cup fourth qualifying round victory over [[Cambridge United F.C.|Cambridge United]] in late October saw him win the [[2012–13 FA Cup Qualifying Rounds#Fourth Round Qualifying|FA Cup Player of the Round]] award.<ref name="Andre Gray Named FA Cup Player Of The Round">{{cite news |first=Steven |last=Coney |title=Andre Gray named FA Cup Player of the Round |url=http://www.thenonleaguefootballpaper.com/latest-news/fa-cup-and-competitions/1650/andre-gray-named-fa-cup-player-of-the-round/ |newspaper=The Non-League Paper |location=London |date=30 October 2012 |accessdate=22 August 2016}}</ref> On 1 December, he helped the Hatters into the third round proper of the FA Cup, scoring the opener in a 2–1 second round victory over [[Dorchester Town F.C.|Dorchester Town]].<ref>{{cite news |title=Luton 2–1 Dorchester |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/20474416 |publisher=BBC Sport |date=1 December 2012 |accessdate=22 August 2016}}</ref> Luton were drawn against Gray's hometown club Wolverhampton Wanderers in the third round and he played 89 minutes of the 1–0 [[Upset (competition)|giant killing]] on 5 January 2013.<ref name="Luton 1–0 Wolves"/> On 14 January, following a run of ten matches in which he scored eight goals, Gray signed a new two-and-a-half-year contract, which would keep him at [[Kenilworth Road]] until June 2015.<ref>{{cite news |title=Football: Andre Gray signs improved terms at Luton Town |url=http://www.bedfordshire-news.co.uk/football-andre-gray-signs-improved-terms-luton-town/story-21706535-detail/story.html |newspaper=Bedfordshire on Sunday |location=Bedford |date=14 January 2013 |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20171012204139/http://www.bedfordshire-news.co.uk/football-andre-gray-signs-improved-terms-luton-town/story-21706535-detail/story.html |archivedate=12 October 2017 |deadurl=yes}}</ref> He played 75 minutes of Luton's shock 1–0 FA Cup fourth round giant killing of Norwich City on 26 January,<ref>{{cite news |first=Chris |last=Osborne |title=Norwich 0–1 Luton |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/21095990 |publisher=BBC Sport |date=26 January 2013 |accessdate=22 August 2016}}</ref> but the Hatters' run was stopped by Millwall in the fifth round, who ran out 3–0 victors.<ref>{{cite news |first=Chris |last=Osborne |title=Luton 0–3 Millwall |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/21448930 |publisher=BBC Sport |date=16 February 2013 |accessdate=22 August 2016}}</ref> Gray rounded out the 2012–13 season with a run of six goals in six matches, which included two braces in the Hatters' final two matches of the season.<ref name=SW/> Gray made 54 appearances and scored 20 goals<ref name=SW/> in a season which saw Luton finish two places outside the play-offs.<ref>{{cite web |title=Report: Southport 1–3 Town |url=https://www.lutontown.co.uk/news/2013/april/report-southport-1-3-town/ |publisher=Luton Town F.C. |date=20 April 2013 |accessdate=9 August 2017}}</ref>
Gray was primarily used as an impact substitute during the beginning of the [[2013–14 Luton Town F.C. season|2013–14 season]], with new signing [[Mark Cullen (English footballer)|Mark Cullen]] preferred in a starting role by new Luton manager [[John Still (footballer)|John Still]].<ref name=ESPN>{{cite web |title=Andre Gray |url=http://www.espnfc.co.uk/player/168830/andre-gray |publisher=ESPN FC |accessdate=22 August 2016}}</ref> He scored his first goal of the season on 24 September 2013, the club's eleventh league match, in a 4–0 victory over [[Woking F.C.|Woking]].<ref>{{cite news |title=Woking 0–4 Luton |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/24122091 |publisher=BBC Sport |date=24 September 2013 |accessdate=22 August 2016}}</ref> He then went on a goalscoring run and reclaimed his place in the team, scoring six goals in five matches, culminating with a [[hat-trick]] in a 4–1 victory over [[Hyde United F.C.|Hyde]] on 12 October.<ref>{{cite news |title=Luton Town 4–1 Hyde |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/24408571 |publisher=BBC Sport |date=12 October 2013 |accessdate=22 August 2016}}</ref> A run of 11 goals in 10 matches from November through to January helped the Hatters to the top of the Conference Premier table.<ref name=SW/> Gray confirmed he had no intention of leaving the club midway through the season, stating that it would be "stupid" to with the club having a realistic chance of promotion back to the [[English Football League|Football League]] and he instructed his [[Sports agent|agent]] to reject any approaches.<ref>{{cite news |title=Transfer window: Luton's Andre Gray rules out 'stupid' move |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/25906011 |publisher=BBC Sport |date=26 January 2014 |accessdate=22 August 2016}}</ref> After scoring a further seven goals in four matches in February, Gray was named as the Conference Premier Player of the Month.<ref name="Still & Gray win awards">{{cite web |title=Still & Gray win awards |url=https://www.lutontown.co.uk/news/2014/february/still--gray-win-awards/ |publisher=Luton Town F.C. |date=26 February 2014 |accessdate=9 August 2017}}</ref> In total, Gray scored 30 goals in 45 appearances during the 2013–14 season,<ref name=SW/> and won the first [[Silverware (sport)|silverware]] of his career, as Luton were promoted back to the Football League as Conference Premier champions.<ref>{{cite news |title=Football: 'The most remarkable season ever' – Luton Town boss John Still hails his record breakers |url=http://www.bedfordshire-news.co.uk/footballthe-remarkable-season-luton-town-boss-john-hails-record-breakers/story-21707183-detail/story.html |newspaper=Bedfordshire on Sunday |location=Bedford |date=27 April 2014 |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20171012224406/http://www.bedfordshire-news.co.uk/footballthe-remarkable-season-luton-town-boss-john-hails-record-breakers/story-21707183-detail/story.html |archivedate=12 October 2017 |deadurl=yes}}</ref> He was recognised by the club for his performances by winning the [[Luton Town F.C. Player of the season#Young Player of the Season|Young Player of the Season]] award.<ref name="Awards Night 2013/14">{{cite web |title=Awards Night 2013/14 |url=https://www.lutontown.co.uk/news/2014/april/awards-night-201314/ |publisher=Luton Town F.C. |date=14 April 2014 |accessdate=9 August 2017}}</ref> Gray was the leading scorer in the Conference Premier (for which he won the league's Golden Boot award) and he was also named in the Conference Premier Team of the Season.<ref name="Luton Town in numbers">{{cite web |title=Luton Town in numbers |url=http://www.football-league.co.uk/features/20140611/luton-town-in-numbers_2293307_3784973 |publisher=The Football League |date=11 June 2014 |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20140714183239/http://www.football-league.co.uk/features/20140611/luton-town-in-numbers_2293307_3784973 |archivedate=14 July 2014 |deadurl=yes}}</ref><ref name="Hatters recognised at Conference awards">{{cite web |title=Hatters recognised at Conference awards |url=https://www.lutontown.co.uk/news/2014/june/hatters-recognised-at-conference-awards/ |publisher=Luton Town F.C. |date=7 June 2014 |accessdate=9 August 2017}}</ref> He was the subject of reported transfer interest from League One neighbours [[Milton Keynes Dons F.C.|Milton Keynes Dons]] in May 2014, but the Dons baulked at his £300,000 price tag.<ref>{{cite web |first=Liam |last=Andrews |title=Dons linked with Gregory and Aldred, but Alli could be off |url=http://citiblog.co.uk/2014/05/15/dons-linked-with-gregory-and-aldred-but-alli-could-be-off/ |publisher=CitiBlog |date=15 May 2014 |accessdate=22 August 2016}}</ref> Gray departed the Hatters in late June 2014, having made 111 appearances and scored 57 goals during his time at Kenilworth Road.<ref name="Non-League Club Directory 2013 2"/><ref name=SW/>
===Brentford=== On 27 June 2014, Gray signed a three-year deal at Championship club [[Brentford F.C.|Brentford]] for an undisclosed fee and was given the number 19 shirt.<ref>{{cite web |first=Ciaran |last=Brett |title=Brentford sign Andre Gray from Luton Town |url=https://www.brentfordfc.com/news/2014/june/brentford-sign-andre-gray-from-luton-town/ |publisher=Brentford F.C. |date=27 June 2014 |accessdate=9 August 2017}}</ref><ref>{{cite web |first=Chris |last=Wickham |title=Brentford F.C. 2014/15 squad numbers |url=https://www.brentfordfc.com/news/2014/august/brentford-fc-201415-squad-numbers/ |publisher=Brentford F.C. |date=6 August 2014 |accessdate=9 August 2017}}</ref> After joining, he said "the fact that the manager wanted me was a big part in selling me on Brentford. They had a vision of how they wanted me to play and also they have a vision for this club. As soon as Brentford came along I knew it was a good opportunity for me".<ref>{{cite web |first=Ciaran |last=Brett |title=Brentford 'by far the best place' for Andre |url=https://www.brentfordfc.com/news/2014/june/brentford-by-far-the-best-place-for-andre/ |publisher=Brentford F.C. |date=29 June 2014 |accessdate=9 August 2017}}</ref> After scoring in [[Exhibition game#Association football|friendlies]] versus [[Barnet F.C.|Barnet]] and [[OGC Nice|Nice]] in July 2014,<ref>{{cite web |first=Chris |last=Wickham |title=Barnet 1 Brentford 5 |url=https://www.brentfordfc.com/news/2014/july/barnet-1-brentford-5/ |publisher=Brentford F.C. |date=22 July 2014 |accessdate=9 August 2017}}</ref><ref>{{cite web |first=Chris |last=Wickham |title=Brentford 3 OGC Nice 2 |url=https://www.brentfordfc.com/news/2014/july/brentford-3-ogc-nice-2/ |publisher=Brentford F.C. |date=26 July 2014 |accessdate=9 August 2017}}</ref> Gray made his competitive debut for the club on the opening day of the [[2014-15 Brentford F.C. season|2014–15 season]] against [[Charlton Athletic F.C.|Charlton Athletic]], making the first Football League start of his career.<ref name="Brentford 1–1 Charlton Athletic">{{cite news |title=Brentford 1–1 Charlton Athletic |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/28646432 |publisher=BBC Sport |date=9 August 2014 |accessdate=22 August 2016}}</ref> He lasted 67 minutes of the 1–1 draw before being replaced by fellow new signing [[Nick Proschwitz]].<ref name="Brentford 1–1 Charlton Athletic"/> Gray scored his first competitive goal for the club in the following match, a 6–6 draw with [[Dagenham & Redbridge F.C.|Dagenham & Redbridge]] in the [[EFL Cup|League Cup]] first round, which Brentford won 4–2 in a [[Penalty shoot-out (association football)|penalty shoot-out]].<ref>{{cite news |title=Dagenham & Redbridge 6–6 Brentford (2–4 pens) |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/28652337 |publisher=BBC Sport |date=13 August 2014 |accessdate=10 August 2017}}</ref> He scored the first Football League goal of his career on the stroke of half-time in a 2–0 win over [[Rotherham United F.C.|Rotherham United]] on 30 August.<ref>{{cite news |title=Rotherham United 0–2 Brentford |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/28909820 |publisher=BBC Sport |date=30 August 2014 |accessdate=1 December 2014}}</ref>
After a long goalless run,<ref name=sb1415/> Gray regained form in November, scoring five goals in four of five successive wins and receiving the [[EFL Championship Player of the Month|Championship Player of the Month]] award.<ref name="Andre Gray named Sky Bet Championship Player of the Month">{{cite web |title=Andre Gray named Sky Bet Championship Player of the Month |url=https://www.efl.com/news/2014/december/andre-gray-named-sky-bet-championship-player-of-the-month/ |publisher=English Football League |date=5 December 2014 |accessdate=9 August 2017}}</ref> He also earned a place in the Football League Team of the Week for his goalscoring performances in wins over [[Nottingham Forest F.C.|Nottingham Forest]] and Millwall in mid-November.<ref name="Football League Team of the Week">{{cite web |first=Ryan |last=Percival |title=Sky Bet Football League Team of the Week |url=https://www.efl.com/news/2014/november/sky-bet-football-league-team-of-the-week2/ |publisher=English Football League |date=10 November 2014 |accessdate=9 August 2017}}</ref> Gray's goal in a 3–2 win over [[Cardiff City F.C.|Cardiff City]] on 20 December was the last of a run of seven goals in eight matches.<ref name=sb1415/> A sparse goal return in the early months of 2015 saw manager [[Mark Warburton]] drop Gray to the bench in favour of [[Chris Long (footballer)|Chris Long]] for the visit of [[Huddersfield Town A.F.C.|Huddersfield Town]] to [[Griffin Park]] on 3 March.<ref name=ESPN/> He quickly regained his starting berth and finished the regular season with four goals in his last 10 appearances,<ref name=ESPN/><ref name=sb1415/> helping Brentford to fifth position and a matchup with [[Middlesbrough F.C.|Middlesbrough]] in the [[2015 Football League play-offs#Championship|play-off semi-finals]].<ref>{{cite web |title=Championship: 2014/15: Latest table |url=http://www.soccerbase.com/tournaments/tournament.sd?tourn_id=1387 |work=Soccerbase |publisher=Centurycomm |accessdate=9 August 2017}}</ref> He scored in the first leg, but a successful first full league season ended after a 5–1 aggregate defeat.<ref name=sb1415/> Gray made 50 appearances and scored 18 goals during the 2014–15 season.<ref name=sb1415/>
Amidst three transfer bids from [[Hull City A.F.C.|Hull City]],<ref>{{cite news |first=Jacob |last=Murtagh |title=Brentford reject third Hull bid for Gray but are eyeing up replacement |url=http://www.getwestlondon.co.uk/sport/football/transfer-news/brentford-reject-third-hull-bid-9841639 |newspaper=Get West London |date=12 August 2015 |accessdate=22 August 2016}}</ref> Gray's two goals in his first two appearances of the [[2015–16 Brentford F.C. season|2015–16 season]] prompted Brentford to offer him a new, improved contract, but he left the club on 21 August 2015.<ref>{{cite news |first=Jacob |last=Murtagh |title=Brentford to offer new deal to star man Andre Gray |url=https://www.mirror.co.uk/sport/football/news/brentford-offer-andre-gray-new-6264232 |newspaper=Daily Mirror |location=London |date=16 August 2015 |accessdate=22 August 2016}}</ref> Gray finished his time at Griffin Park having scored 20 goals in 52 appearances and departed for a club-record fee.<ref>{{cite web |first=Mark |last=Chapman |title=Andre Gray joins Burnley from Brentford for an undisclosed fee |url=https://www.brentfordfc.com/news/2015/august/andre-gray-joins-burnley-/ |publisher=Brentford F.C. |date=21 August 2015 |accessdate=9 August 2017}}</ref>
===Burnley=== [[File:Andre Gray 28-11-2015 1.jpg|thumb|upright|Gray playing for [[Burnley F.C.|Burnley]] in 2015]]
On 21 August 2015, Gray joined Championship club [[Burnley F.C.|Burnley]] on a three-year contract for an undisclosed fee – believed to be a club-record £6 million deal – double the previous record jointly held by [[George Boyd (footballer)|George Boyd]] and [[Steven Fletcher (footballer)|Steven Fletcher]].<ref name="Gray is the new Claret">{{cite web |title=Gray is the new Claret |url=https://www.burnleyfootballclub.com/news/2015/august/gray-is-the-new-claret/ |publisher=Burnley F.C. |date=21 August 2015 |accessdate=9 August 2017}}</ref><ref>{{cite news |title=Clarets smash record to sign Gray |url=http://www.burnleyexpress.net/sport/football/clarets/clarets-smash-record-to-sign-gray-1-7423073 |newspaper=Burnley Express |date=21 August 2015 |accessdate=17 September 2016}}</ref> Gray signed on the eve of Brentford's Championship clash at Turf Moor but wasn't eligible to make his debut against his former club, having signed too late.<ref>{{cite news |first=Suzanne |last=Geldard |title=Burnley smash club transfer record to sign Andre Gray from Brentford |url=http://www.lancashiretelegraph.co.uk/sport/13618854.UPDATE__Burnley_smash_club_transfer_record_to_sign_Andre_Gray_from_Brentford/ |newspaper=Lancashire Telegraph |location=Blackburn |date=22 August 2015 |accessdate=17 September 2016}}</ref>
Gray's former club Luton Town revealed their financial windfall after the striker's transfer to Burnley. A club statement read: "We are guaranteed to receive a shade over £1.1 million from the fee which will be spread over three seasons; an initial figure approaching £300,000 followed by two of just over £400,000 each".<ref>{{cite news |first=Chris |last=Boden |title=Barton speculation wide of the mark |url=http://www.burnleyexpress.net/sport/football/clarets/barton-speculation-wide-of-the-mark-1-7426400 |newspaper=Burnley Express |date=24 August 2015 |accessdate=17 September 2016}}</ref>
On 29 August 2015, Gray made his Burnley debut in a 2–1 [[Ashton Gate Stadium|away]] victory over [[Bristol City F.C.|Bristol City]].<ref>{{cite web |title=Bristol City 1 Burnley 2 |url=https://www.burnleyfootballclub.com/news/2015/august/bristol-city-1-burnley-2/ |publisher=Burnley F.C. |date=29 August 2015 |accessdate=9 August 2017}}</ref> He followed up his debut by scoring his first goal for the club in second half [[stoppage time]] to complete a 3–1 home win over [[Sheffield Wednesday F.C.|Sheffield Wednesday]] two weeks later.<ref>{{cite news |title=Burnley 3–1 Sheffield Wednesday |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/34160306 |publisher=BBC Sport |date=12 September 2015 |accessdate=22 August 2016}}</ref> Gray's goalscoring run of eight goals in eight matches during October and November helped Burnley keep pace with the league leaders.<ref name=sb1516/> A further seven goals in nine matches from late December to early February, including a hat-trick in a 4–0 win over Bristol City increased his goalscoring tally to 15, as Burnley chased the automatic promotion positions in the Championship table.<ref name=sb1516/> Gray scored eight goals in Burnley's remaining matches to help them reach the Championship summit,<ref name=sb1516/> including one on the final day of the [[2015–16 Burnley F.C. season|2015–16 season]] as Burnley secured the Championship title after a 3–0 [[The Valley (London)|away]] win over Charlton Athletic.<ref>{{cite news |title=Charlton Athletic 0–3 Burnley |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/36176219 |publisher=BBC Sport |date=7 May 2016 |accessdate=22 August 2016}}</ref> During this time, Gray was named [[EFL Awards|Championship Player of the Year]] and won the Golden Boot award after finishing as [[EFL Championship#Top scorers|Championship top scorer]] with 25 goals, including the two he scored in his appearances for Brentford.<ref name="Burnley's Andre Gray named Sky Bet Championship Player of the Year">{{cite web |title=Burnley's Andre Gray named Sky Bet Championship Player of the Year |url=https://www.efl.com/news/2016/april/burnleys-andre-gray-named-sky-bet-championship-player-of-the-year/ |publisher=English Football League |date=17 April 2016 |accessdate=9 August 2017}}</ref><ref name="'Padiham Predator' backs Andre Gray to be Premier League success for Clarets">{{cite news |first=Tyrone |last=Marshall |title='Padiham Predator' backs Andre Gray to be Premier League success for Clarets |url=http://www.lancashiretelegraph.co.uk/sport/14569145.Burnley_legend_backs_Andre_Gray_to_be_Premier_League_success_for_Clarets/ |newspaper=Lancashire Telegraph |location=Blackburn |date=21 June 2016 |accessdate=22 August 2016}}</ref>
Gray made his [[Premier League]] debut on the opening day of the [[2016–17 Burnley F.C. season|2016–17 season]] in a 1–0 home defeat to [[Swansea City A.F.C.|Swansea City]].<ref>{{cite news |first=Tim |last=Oscroft |title=Burnley 0–1 Swansea City |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/36994442 |publisher=BBC Sport |date=13 August 2016 |accessdate=22 August 2016}}</ref> One week later, he followed up his Premier League debut by scoring his first Premier League goal in a 2–0 home win over [[Liverpool F.C.|Liverpool]].<ref>{{cite news |first=Chris |last=Bevan |title=Burnley 2–0 Liverpool |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/37067882 |publisher=BBC Sport |date=20 August 2016 |accessdate=22 August 2016}}</ref> Gray scored his first Premier League hat-trick in a 4–1 victory over [[Sunderland A.F.C.|Sunderland]] on 31 December 2016 to become the first Burnley player to score a Premier League hat-trick and the first Burnley player to score a top flight hat-trick since [[Peter Noble]] in 1975.<ref>{{cite news |first=Michael |last=Emons |title=Burnley 4–1 Sunderland |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/38424664 |publisher=BBC Sport |date=31 December 2016 |accessdate=4 January 2017}}</ref><ref>{{cite news |first=Tyrone |last=Marshall |title='It just proves anything's possible' – Hat-trick hero Andre Gray says Burnley are looking up the table |url=http://www.lancashiretelegraph.co.uk/sport/football/14997216.__39_It_just_proves_anything__39_s_possible__39____Hat_trick_hero_Andre_Gray_says_Burnley_are_looking_up_the_table/ |newspaper=Lancashire Telegraph |location=Blackburn |date=1 January 2017 |accessdate=4 January 2017}}</ref> Gray finished the 2016–17 season with 36 appearances and 10 goals,<ref name=sb1617/> helping Burnley to finish 16th in the Premier League.<ref>{{cite web |title=Premier League: 2016/17: Latest table |url=http://www.soccerbase.com/tournaments/tournament.sd?tourn_id=1501 |work=Soccerbase |publisher=Centurycomm |accessdate=9 August 2017}}</ref>
===Watford=== On 9 August 2017, Gray signed for Premier League club [[Watford F.C.|Watford]] on a five-year contract for an undisclosed club record fee, after he rejected the offer of a new contract at Burnley, having entered the final year of his contract.<ref>{{cite news |first=Juliette |last=Ferrington |title=Andre Gray: Watford sign Burnley striker for club record fee |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/40872618 |publisher=BBC Sport |date=9 August 2017 |accessdate=9 August 2017}}</ref>
==International career== Gray's goalscoring record for Luton in the final months of the 2011–12 season raised the attention of the [[England national football C team|England C]] team and he was named in the squad for an [[International Challenge Trophy]] match against [[Russia national football team|Russia U23]] in June 2012.<ref>{{cite news |first=Mark |last=Wood |title=Gray: I won't be meeting Wayne Rooney while with England C! |url=http://www.lutontoday.co.uk/sport/football/luton-town/gray-i-won-t-be-meeting-wayne-rooney-while-with-england-c-1-3899362 |newspaper=Luton Today |date=31 May 2012 |accessdate=17 September 2016}}</ref> He made his debut in a 4–0 defeat, playing the full 90 minutes.<ref>{{cite news |first=Mark |last=Wood |title=Gray makes debut but Russians nuke England C |url=http://www.lutontoday.co.uk/sport/football/luton-town/gray-makes-debut-but-russians-nuke-england-c-1-3921965 |newspaper=Luton Today |date=6 June 2012 |accessdate=17 September 2016}}</ref> He was later called into the squad to face [[Belgium national football team|Belgium U23]] in September 2012.<ref>{{cite news |title=Gray named in England C squad |url=http://www.lutontoday.co.uk/sport/football/luton-town/gray-named-in-england-c-squad-1-4206790 |newspaper=Luton Today |date=29 August 2012 |accessdate=17 September 2016}}</ref> He came on as a [[half-time]] substitute for [[Stephen Brogan]] and scored his first international goal with the winner in a 2–1 victory. The win saw England C qualify for the semi-final of the International Challenge Trophy.<ref>{{cite web |title=Gray goal gives England victory |url=https://www.lutontown.co.uk/news/2012/september/gray-goal-gives-england-victory/ |publisher=Luton Town F.C. |date=12 September 2012 |accessdate=9 August 2017}}</ref> He played in the semi-final on 5 February 2013 against [[Turkey A2 national football team|Turkey A2]], which England C lost 1–0.<ref>{{cite news |first=Mike |last=Simmonds |title=Ainge absence costs England C |url=http://www.lutontoday.co.uk/sport/football/luton-town/ainge-absence-costs-england-c-1-4762177 |newspaper=Luton Today |date=7 February 2013 |accessdate=17 September 2016}}</ref> Gray captained England C in the second half of a 6–1 friendly win over [[Bermuda national football team|Bermuda]] on 5 June 2013, scoring the team's sixth goal.<ref>{{cite news |first=Mike |last=Simmonds |title=Gray skippers England C to huge win in Bermuda |url=http://www.lutontoday.co.uk/sport/football/luton-town/gray-skippers-england-c-to-huge-win-in-bermuda-1-5160648 |newspaper=Luton Today |date=5 June 2013 |accessdate=17 September 2016}}</ref> He appeared again in a 2–2 friendly draw with [[Czech Republic national under-21 football team|Czech Republic U21]] in November 2013, starting the match and lasting 70 minutes before being replaced by Dan Fitchett.<ref>{{cite news |first=Mike |last=Simmonds |title=Hatters duo help England C to Czech Republic draw |url=http://www.lutontoday.co.uk/sport/football/luton-town/hatters-duo-help-england-c-to-czech-republic-draw-1-5695175 |newspaper=Luton Today |date=20 November 2013 |accessdate=17 September 2016}}</ref> Gray played in a friendly versus [[Jordan national football team|Jordan U23]] at the [[King Abdullah Stadium]] in [[Amman, Jordan|Amman]] on 4 March 2014, starting in a 1–0 victory and was replaced by Dan Fitchett at half-time.<ref>{{cite web |first=Matthew |last=Badcock |title=Luke Berry nets only goal as England C beat Jordan U23s |url=http://www.thefa.com/news/england/development/2014/mar/jordan-u23-0-1-england-c-report |publisher=The Football Association |date=4 March 2014 |accessdate=22 August 2016}}</ref> Gray's return to the Football League in June 2014 meant that he was no longer eligible for England C. He won six caps and scored two goals.<ref>{{cite web |title=Andre Gray |url=http://www.brentfordfc.co.uk/team/player-profile/andre-gray/19 |publisher=Brentford F.C. |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20150415112820/http://www.brentfordfc.co.uk/team/player-profile/andre-gray/19 |archivedate=15 April 2015 |deadurl=yes}}</ref>
==Personal life== Gray was born in [[Wolverhampton]], West Midlands.<ref name=Hugman1011/> He was introduced to football by his grandfather and suffered heartbreak at 13-years-old when his grandfather died.<ref name="Andre Gray Bossing Things Both On And Off The Pitch"/> Acting as a mentor and father figure for his younger half-brother Cody, Gray said "I know what my grandad wants me to do and that's look after my family. It's driving me to work harder".<ref name="Andre Gray Bossing Things Both On And Off The Pitch"/> He is an [[Arsenal F.C.|Arsenal]] supporter.<ref>{{cite news |first=David |last=Anderson |title=Boyhood Arsenal fan Andre Gray cannot wait for Burnley's "massive" FA Cup trip to the Emirates |url=https://www.mirror.co.uk/sport/football/news/boyhood-arsenal-fan-andre-gray-7271829 |newspaper=Daily Mirror |location=London |date=29 January 2016 |accessdate=22 August 2016}}</ref> Gray has a four-inch scar on his left cheek having been stabbed in the face in Wolverhampton in a [[Gang|gang-related]] incident in 2011.<ref>{{cite news |first=Jeremy |last=Wilson |title=Andre Gray: 'Being stabbed turned my life around' |url=https://www.telegraph.co.uk/sport/football/teams/brentford/11590695/Andre-Gray-Being-stabbed-turned-my-life-around.html |newspaper=The Daily Telegraph |location=London |date=7 May 2015 |accessdate=22 August 2016}}</ref> He spoke in May 2015 of having started to grow out of the gang lifestyle around the time of the incident and credited his mother, close friends and Luton Town for turning his life around.<ref>{{cite news |first=Tom |last=Moore |title=Brentford star reflects on rise from being stabbed to play-off with Middlesbrough |url=http://www.getwestlondon.co.uk/sport/football/football-news/brentford-star-reflects-rise-being-9203550 |newspaper=Get West London |date=8 May 2015 |accessdate=22 August 2016}}</ref>
On 23 August 2016, Gray was charged with misconduct by the FA after a series of homophobic tweets he posted on Twitter in 2012 came to light.<ref>{{cite web |title=Andre Gray: FA charges Burnley striker with misconduct over tweets |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/37169558 |publisher=BBC Sport |date=23 August 2016 |accessdate=23 August 2016}}</ref> Four days later, it was reported that the FA were also investigating another tweet posted by Gray in 2014 which included a derogatory racial term.<ref>{{cite news |first=Daniel |last=Taylor |title=Andre Gray's FA charge sheet grows with 2014 'I hate lightys' tweet |url=https://www.theguardian.com/football/2016/aug/27/andre-gray-fa-charge-i-hate-lightys |newspaper=The Guardian |location=London |date=27 August 2016 |accessdate=28 August 2016}}</ref><ref>{{cite web |title=Andre Gray: Burnley striker wants homophobic tweets charge personal hearing |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/37278968 |publisher=BBC Sport |date=5 September 2016 |accessdate=6 September 2016}}</ref> On 23 September, Gray was suspended for four matches and fined £25,000.<ref>{{cite web |title=Andre Gray: Burnley striker banned for four matches for social media comments |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/37456995 |publisher=BBC Sport |date=23 September 2016 |accessdate=23 September 2016}}</ref>
In late 2016, Gray entered a relationship with [[Little Mix#Leigh-Anne Pinnock|Leigh-Anne Pinnock]] of [[Little Mix]].<ref>{{cite news |first=Gideon |last=Brooks |title=Burnley star Andre Gray on putting his troubled past behind him and climbing up the league |url=http://www.express.co.uk/sport/football/754017/Andre-Gray-Burnley-non-league-Premier-League-stabbed-in-face |newspaper=Daily Express |location=London |date=14 January 2017 |accessdate=14 February 2017}}</ref><ref>{{cite news |first=Chris |last=Gee |title=Striker Andre Gray's girlfriend supports Clarets when modelling away shirt in tweet from US tour |url=http://www.lancashiretelegraph.co.uk/news/15085882.Striker_Andre_Gray___s_girlfriend_supports_Clarets_when_modelling_away_shirt_in_tweet_from_US_tour/ |newspaper=Lancashire Telegraph |location=Blackburn |date=11 February 2017 |accessdate=14 February 2017}}</ref>
